intro: Hemiphues suffocata var. novae-zelandiae, commonly known as the New Zealand hemiphues, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and white, often appearing in clusters, and it produces woody pods containing seeds. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
